title.narrative: 4.2 EDUCATION OUT OF SCHOOL

description.narrative: 150,000 excluded children and adolescents have access to formal or alternative pathways to primary education., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the GER for primary school has increased by 9 per cent, ensuring safe, equitable and quality education, with improved learning outcomes for learners at pre-primary, primary and secondary levels, with a focus on the most disadvantaged and vulnerable children, especially girls, populations and geographic areas.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 150,000 excluded children and adolescents have access to formal or alternative pathways to primary education.

description.narrative: A total of 99,021 children and adolescents (46% girls) were reached through different education services in the South Central regions: 2,650 vulnerable children (50% girls) continued schooling through the ongoing provision of educational scholarships in Puntland; 25,355 rural and pastoralist children (47% girls) were able to access basic education through the distribution of uniforms, take-home food rations and water supplies in schools in Somaliland. | Status:Met | As-of Date:29/12/2020
